author: Steven Sexton
title: The U.S. Olympic Monopoly Needs Accountability
text:
Shortly after criticizing leaders of the U.S. Olympic Committee in a local television interview earlier this month, rapid-fire pistol shooter Keith Sanderson was booted from the men’s national team and kicked out of the U.S. Olympic Training Center in Colorado Springs, Colo. USA Shooting, the organization approved by USOC to manage the sport, accused the three-time Olympian of multiple violations of its code of conduct. Mr. Sanderson, who was elected by fellow elite athletes to represent them on the Athletes’ Advisory Council, claims he’s being punished for his outspokenness.
